response.answer_text: Previously answered: Originally Answered: Why is Ronald Reagan considered a great president in the US?Remove Banner Of the major failings of Reagan as a President (and there were many), I haven’t seen any answers which include the following: he used our money to bail out his rich friends in the savings and loan industry, he regularly fell asleep in cabinet meetings, he indulged in thinly veiled racism harping about “welfare queens,” he funded antileft military action in Central America through an elaborate drug operation (the infamous Iran-Contra affair), but undoubtedly the worst, he backed numerous massacres of entire Central American villages, mostly Native American, because they were felt to support left-wing politicians. This was no great President but quite the opposite, a horrible one.

Lots of covert crap I mean declaring a war on drugs than empowering the CIA to become the larges coke cartel in the world with the assets we seized from the cartels, then using that coke money to finance weapons and training to terrorists groups including the Taliban who later turned against us when we cut off the money and weapons. Iran Contra the list goes on and on. He did a lot of great things too and in the end he did stare down Gorbachev and bankrupt the Soviet Union.
